item.title: The McKinney Student Writing Contest Is Now Open!
item.description: The 2025 McKinney Writing Contest is open, and both undergraduate and graduate students are invited to submit entries in a wide range of categories to win cash prizes! Entries are due by midnight on March 11, 2025. Please see the McKinney Writing Contest page for more information, or email the contest committee if you have questions.

item.title: Dr. Scott Oshiro to Lead Quantum Music Workshop
item.description: Join HASS at 5:00PM on November 21 in Sage 2510 for this hands-on workshop, which offers an introduction to quantum computing with a focus on developing computer music applications. The workshop will cover various building blocks and fundamentals of quantum computing, followed by sections on quantum algorithms and how they are used in current quantum computer music applications.

item.title: RPI Researcher Receives Grants to Study Quantum Materials and Superconductors
item.description: Wei Bao, Ph.D., assistant professor in Rensselaer’s Department of Materials Science and Engineering, has won the Early Career Program Award and Defense University Research Instrumentation Program Award from the Department of Defense to study superconductors and cavity quantum materials, respectively. The two awarded grants, which total nearly $700,000, will allow Bao to further his research into the unique properties of quantum materials and lay the foundation for future practical innovations.

item.title: RPI Bicentennial Holiday Concert, Victorian Stroll Kick-Off Scheduled for December 7
item.description: Date: Saturday, December 7, 2024 7:00 PM - Join us for this Bicentennial celebration, in partnership with the Rensselaer County Regional Chamber of Commerce, that kicks off the Troy Victorian Stroll! The Bicentennial Holiday Concert will feature performances by the Rensselaer Orchestra, Concert Choir, and Wind Symphony, and will include works by Brahms, Holst, Thorvaldsdottir, Wagner, and Borodin.

item.title: “The Body as a Landscape” Student Work Exhibit Opens November 21
item.description: Scheduled to take place from 6:00PM to 7:00PM on Thursday, November 21 in the Dean’s Gallery on the fifth floor of the Sage Building, this exhibition consists of student works from Professor Ruiz’ Intermediate Digital Imaging class Fall ‘24, and serves as a medium to display the complexity of the human body, the natural, and the built environment, while highlighting the uniqueness of individual gestural movement.
